links.title: China's cyber-spying 'keeps a lot of US tech CEOs up at night'
links.description: A Bloomberg report alleges China slipped tiny spy chips into computer hardware from a firm called Super Micro, which supplied Amazon and Apple. The companies denied the report, but threat of Chinese cyberespionage is keeping tech CEOs up at night.

links.title: Bloomberg stands by Chinese chip story as Apple, Amazon ratchet up denials
links.description: On Thursday morning, Bloomberg published a bombshell story claiming that the Chinese government had used tiny microchips to infiltrate the data centers of Apple and Amazon. Apple and Amazon, for their part, responded with unusually specific and categorical denials.

messages.body: Raised by YouTube - The Atlantic $goog  https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2018/11/raised-by-youtube/570838/

links.title: Raised by YouTube
links.description: The platform's entertainment for children is weirder-and more globalized-than adults could have expected. ChuChu TV, thecompany responsible for some of the most widely viewed toddler content on YouTube, has a suitably cute origin story. Vinoth Chandar, the CEO, had always played around on YouTube, making Hindu devotionals and little videos of his father, a well-known Indian music producer.

(GOOG) Technical Analysis Report for Oct 05, 2018 Highlights Overview Moving lower for the 2nd day in a row, GOOG ended the week -3.03% lower at 1157.35 after losing $10.84 (-0.93%) today following today's NFP report. links.title: 9 things to expect from the Google Pixel 3 event next week
links.description: On October 9th, Google will hold an event to unveil the latest products in its Pixel, Home, and Chromecast lines. It'll be Google's chance to wow consumers before the holidays and to answer its competitors. In just the past few weeks, Apple announced two new iPhones, and Amazon unveiled a slew of new Alexa products.
